text: from tiny red dots, sometimes referred to as cayenne pepper spots, which group together to form a flat red patch. Over time, these patches become brown and then slowly fade away, over weeks to months. There have been no systemic symptoms reported with pigmented purpuric eruption. The Human Phenotype Ontology provides the following list of signs and symptoms for Pigmented purpuric eruption.
